meanings.sent1: The feather will kittle your nose.
meanings.sent2: I can't help but kittle my own arm when it's itchy.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten tried to kittle my toes.
meanings.sent4: The gentle breeze seemed to kittle the leaves on the tree.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric kittle my skin like a gentle touch.

meanings.sent1: The riddle will kittle your brain.
meanings.sent2: Her mysterious smile never failed to kittle my curiosity.
meanings.sent3: The confusing directions managed to kittle my sense of direction.
meanings.sent4: The complex math problem seemed to kittle my logical thinking.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected twist in the story kittle my understanding of the plot.

meanings.sent1: The child would kittle in his seat during the long lecture.
meanings.sent2: The restless dog would kittle around the room before finally settling down.
meanings.sent3: The wind made the leaves kittle on the branches.
meanings.sent4: The uneasy feeling seemed to kittle in the pit of her stomach.
meanings.sent5: The nervous energy made her feet kittle with anticipation.
